description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8do8u","text":"To study the heterogeneity of complex tissues by joint profiling of gene expression and its regulation, we require an accurate and high-throughput method. Here we described improved high-throughput combinatorial indexing-based single-nucleus chromatin accessibility and mRNA expression sequencing 2 (SNARE-Seq2) co-assay. This protocol involves fixing and permeabilizing the nucleus followed by tagmentation, chromatin barcode ligation, reverse transcription, pooling and splitting for the next rounds of cell barcode ligation into cDNA and accessible chromatin (AC) on the same nucleus. The captured cDNA and AC are co-amplified before splitting and enrichment into single-nucleus RNA and single-nucleus AC sequencing libraries. The protocol can also be applied to both nuclei and whole cells to capture mRNA in the cytoplasm. This improvement allows us to generate hundreds of thousands of data set of each assay and can be scaled up to half a million cells from a single experiment. The entire procedure can be complete in 3.5 d for generating joint single-nucleus RNA and single-nucleus ATAC sequencing libraries.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"56s84","text":"This is a modification of the original published protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Advantage UltraPure dNTP combination kit (100 mM each dNTP)
Bovine Serum Albumin (20 mg/mL) Molecular Biology Grade
8-strip PCR tube with individually attached bubble
T4 DNA Ligase Reaction Buffer - 6.0 ml
Magnesium chloride solution for molecular biology (1.00 M)
Ethanol Pure 200 proof for molecular biology

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bbjoj","text":"40% (wt/vol) PEG 6000. Weigh 16.0 g of PEG 6000 in 50 mL tube. Add nuclease-free water and bring the total volume to 40 mL. Rotate the tube at room temperature until PEG 6000 completely dissolved. Spin down the tube at 200 g for 2 min, at room temperature to remove the tiny bubble. CRITICAL: 40% (wt/vol) of PEG 6000 is very viscous and difficult to filter through a 0.22 µm filter. We suggest preparing 40% PEG freshly before making GLR buffer. When PEG is diluted in 4x GLR buffer, it is easier to filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54rq","text":"4x GLR buffer. To prepare 40 mL of 4x GLR buffer, Add 2.64 mL of nuclease-free water, 10.56 mL of 1 M Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 0.8 mL of 1 M MgCl2 and 4 mL of 2 M KCl into 50 mL tube. Gently mix well by vortexing. Add 22 mL of 40% (wt/vol) PEG 6000 and gently mix well by vortexing. Filter through 0.22 µm into a new 50 mL tube and briefly spin the tube at room temperature for 30 s. Aliquot 1.8 mL into 2 mL tubes to minimize contamination from each use and store at 4 ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"99vdq","text":"10% (vol/vol) Triton X-100. Slowly aspirate 2.0 mL of Triton X-100 liquid with low retention pipette tip and slowly dispend into 18.0 mL nuclease-free water in 50 mL tube. Dissolve Triton X-100 by slowly rotate the tube until the solution is clear. Filter 10% Triton X-100 solution through 0.22 µm syringe filter into a new 50 mL tube and store at room temperature. CRITICAL: If it’s difficult to pipette Triton X-100 accurately as it’s a viscous liquid, we may warm it at 37 ºC before pipetting","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avg38","text":"10% (vol/vol) Tween 20. Tween 20 is very viscous liquid and difficult to pipette accurately. We convert the volume in cm3 into grams using the density of tween 20 at 25 ºC is 1.1 cm3. To prepare 20 mL of 10% (vol/vol) Tween 20, weigh 2.2 g of Tween 20 in 50 mL tube. Add 18.0 mL of nuclease-free water and invert or rotate the tube slowly at room temperature until Tween 20 is completely dissolved in water. Filter 10% Tween 20 solution through 0.22 µm syringe filter into a new 50 mL tube and store at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eebvl","text":"25 mM dNTP mix. Mix 250 µL each of 100 mM dATP, dCTP, dGTP and dTTP in 1.5 mL tube. Mix well by vortexing and briefly spin the tube at room temperature for 5 s. Aliquot 250 µL into each of 1.5 mL tube and store at -20 ºC for a couple of years","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9n2v9","text":"2x Lysis buffer. To prepare 25 mL of 2x Lysis buffer, add 6.5 mL of nuclease-free water into 50 mL tube. Add 0.5 mL of 1 M Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 2 mL of 5 M NaCl, 5 mL of 0.5 M EDTA and 11 mL of 10% (wt/vol) SDS. Gently mix and aliquot 1.8 mL into 2 mL tubes and store at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5t5g0","text":"1x B\u0026W-T buffer. To prepare 40 mL of 1x B\u0026W-T, add 31.56 mL of nuclease-free water into 50 mL tube. Add 200 µL of 1 M Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 8 mL of 5 M NaCl, 40 µL of 0.5 M EDTA and 200 µL of 10% (vol/vol) Tween 20. Gently mix by vortexing and store at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fud7s","text":"2x B\u0026W buffer. To prepare 25 mL of 1x B\u0026W, add 14.7 mL of nuclease-free water into 50 mL tube. Add 250 µL of 1 M Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 10 mL of 5 M NaCl, and 50 µL of 0.5 M EDTA. Mix well by vortexing and store at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evscm","text":"0.1 M PMSF. Weigh 34.8 mg of PMSF and transfer into 2 mL microtube. Add 100% isopropanol to 2 mL and vortex vigorously to dissolve PMSF. Quick spin the tube down and transfer all solution into 3 mL syringe. Filter through a 0.22 µm syringe filter to a new 2 mL tube. Aliquot 50 µL per 0.2 mL PCR tube and store at -20 ºC for up to 4 months. CRITICAL: To maintain the activity of PMSF in solution, store PMSF in single-use aliquots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ddjf9","text":"Transposon preparation. Resuspend Nextera adapter 1, 5P-Nextera adapter 2 and mosaic end (ME) oligos with nuclease-free water to 100 µM. Mix 500 µL of 100 µM Nextera adapter 1 and 500 µL of 100 µM ME in 1.5 mL DNA LoBind microtube, aliquot 30 µL of non-annealed transposons into each of 0.2 mL PCR tube and store at -20 ºC for up to 1-2 years. Prepare 5P-Nextera adapter 2 and ME the same way as Nextera adapter 1. All sequences of oligos can be found in the attached tables.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c8o1o","text":"Accessible chromatin (AC) Round 1 barcoded oligos preparation (Plate A). Prepare 50 µL of 25 µM accessible chromatin (AC) Round 1 barcoded oligos annealed with 23 µM accessible chromatin (AC) Round 1 linker oligos (BC_0100)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"68ur9","text":"Resuspend AC Round 1 linker (BC_0100) with nuclease-free water to final concentration of 1 mM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5opd1","text":"Prepare 2.5 mL of 30.67 µM AC Round 1 linker by adding 76.68 µL of 1 mM of AC Round 1 linker to 2,423.32 µL of nuclease-free water in 5 mL tube and mix well by vortexing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f295d","text":"Add 12.5 µL of 100 µM AC Round 1 barcoded oligos into 96-well plate (total 48 wells, rows A - D) with multichannel pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b0m4q","text":"Transfer AC Round 1 linker oligos into 25 mL reservoir","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmbpu","text":"Add 37.5 µL of 30.67 µM AC Round 1 linker into each well of AC Round 1 barcodes with multichannel pipette and mix well by pipetting 12 times (mixing volume 45 µL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"936n6","text":"CRITICAL STEP: Seal and spin down the plate on 96-well plate swinging bucket rotor at 160 g for 1min, 4 ºC. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8ai0","text":"Anneal AC Round 1 barcoded oligos and AC linker oligos on thermocycler using the following annealing program: 95 ºC for 2 min, slowly cool down to 20 ºC (0.1 ºC/s) and hold at 4 ºC. CRITICAL STEP: After annealing oligonucleotides in the plate, we recommend spinning down the plate and use a sterile needle to punch the holes on the sealing film to release the pressure in every single well. Otherwise, the liquid inside the well will be pulled up to the top of the well when the film is unsealed, and this can lead to barcode cross-contamination. PAUSE POINT: If do not want to continue to mix these annealed oligos in the next step, store that plate at -20 ºC ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3hqlh","text":"RNA reverse transcription (RT) Round 1 barcoded oligos preparation (Plate B). Prepare 50 µL of 25 µM of oligo (dT)15 and 25 µM of random hexamer (N6) RT barcoded oligos (see attached tables) mix in each of 48 wells. CRITICAL STEP: 100 µM of dT and N6 reverse transcription barcoded oligos are ordered in row A-D and row E-H of oligo plate, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9lf0l","text":"Transfer 12.5 µL of 100 µM of rows A-D (dT) in the RT barcoded oligos plate to rows A-D of a new 96-well DNA LoBind plate. CRITICAL STEP If use electronic multichannel pipette, add 1 µL of air after aspirating to avoid cross-contamination of barcoded oligos. This can be applied to other steps when we have to transfer barcoded oligos from stock plate to a new plate. Make sure that oligos are delivered to the bottom of the well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3d0m","text":"Transfer 12.5 µL of 100 µM of rows E-H oligos (N6) in RT barcoded oligos plate to rows A-D (row E to row A, row F to row B, row G to row C, row H to row D) of 96-well plate that contains dT barcoded oligos above","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"53mkt","text":"Pipette 2 mL of nuclease-free water into 25 mL reservoir","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fm58","text":"Add 25 µL of nuclease-free water to row A-D of RNA Round 1 stock plate and mix well by pipetting 12 times (mixing volume 45 µL) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6s5tb","text":"Seal and spin down the plate at 160 g for 1 min, 4 ºC and leave the plate on ice or PCR cool rack","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jkuo","text":"AC Round 1 barcoded oligos and RT Round 1 barcoded oligos mix. The final concentration of each oligo (dT, N6, AC) in the oligo mix is 12.5 µM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95bi4","text":"Transfer 50 µL of oligos in plate B (RT Round 1 barcoded oligos) into plate A that contain 50 µL of annealed AC Round 1 barcoded oligos and linker at identical well IDs (rows A-D) and mix well by pipetting 12 times (mixing volume 90 µL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4sal3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14p0h","text":"Spin down the plate at 160 g for 1 min, 4 ºC and put the plate on PCR cool rack","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"celmt","text":"Aliquot 4 µL of mixed Round 1 barcoded oligos (rows A-D) into 10-25 of 96-well plates as “working plates”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8s1c9","text":"Spin down working plates at 160 g for 1 min, 4 ºC and store at -20 ºC for up to a couple of years. Store the left over Round 1 stock plate at -20 ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9pg1","text":"Ligation Round 2 barcoded oligos. Prepare stock plate of 100 µL of 18 µM ligation Round 2 barcoded oligos annealed with 16.5 µM ligation Round 2 linker (BC_0215).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4qob","text":"Resuspend ligation Round 2 linker (BC_0215) with nuclease-free water to final concentration of 1 mM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2m13d","text":"Prepare 9 mL of 20.12 µM ligation Round 2 linker by adding 181.08 µL of 1 mM round 2 linker to 8,818.9 µL of nuclease-free water in 15 mL tube and mix well by vortexing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ce03j","text":"Add 18 µL of 100 µM of ligation round 2 barcoded oligos into 96-well plate (rows A-H)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"624t1","text":"Transfer ligation Round 2 linker into 25 mL reservoir","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7co3o","text":"Add 82 µL of 20.12 µM ligation Round 2 linker to each well of ligation Round 2 barcoded oligos with and mix well by pipetting 10 times (mixing volume 90 µL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9s2ra","text":"Seal and spin down the plate at 160 g for 1min, 4 ºC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2g4qi","text":"Anneal ligation Round 2 barcoded oligos and Round 2 linker on thermocycler using the annealing program for Round 1 barcoded oligos and keep on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"qssr","text":"Spin down the plate at 160 g for 1min, 4 ºC and keep on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cj8iq","text":"Aliquot 10 µL of annealed ligation Round 2 barcoded/linker oligos into 10 of 96-well plate as “working plate”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cv03c","text":"Spin down the working plate at 160 g for 1min, 4 ºC before store at -20ºC for up to a couple of year","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"64bk","text":"Ligation Round 3 barcoded oligos. Prepare stock plate of 100 µL of 21 µM Round 3 barcoded oligos annealed with 19.5 µM ligation Round 3 linker (BC_0060).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jvil","text":"Resuspend ligation Round 3 linker (BC_0060) with nuclease-free water to final concentration of 1 mM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ckb6r","text":"Prepare 8.5 mL of 24.68 µM ligation Round 3 linker by adding 209.8 µL of 1 mM Round 3 linker to 8,290.2 µL of nuclease-free water in 15 mL tube and mix well by vortexing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1l94c","text":"Add 21 µL of 100 µM of ligation Round 3 barcoded oligos into 96-well plate (rows A-H)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1vsuc","text":"Transfer ligation Round 3 linker into 25 mL reservoir","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dogf6","text":"Add 79 µL of 24.68 µM ligation Round 3 linker to each well of ligation Round 3 barcoded oligos and mix well by pipetting 12 times (mixing volume 90 µL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"98ds8","text":"Seal and spin down the plate at 160 g for 1min, 4 ºC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"16maf","text":"Anneal ligation Round 3 barcoded oligos and Round 3 linker on thermocycler using the annealing program for Round 1 barcoded oligos and keep on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9muaa","text":"Spin down the plate at 160 g for 1min, 4 ºC and keep on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7qvo1","text":"Aliquot 10 µL of annealed ligation Round 3 barcoded/linker oligos into 10 of 96-well plate as “working plate”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cb0p0","text":"Spin down the working plate at 160 g for 1min, 4 ºC before store at -20ºC for up to a couple of year","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qo29","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rmh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dqn02","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5a3d0","text":"Convert Tn5 transposase (Diagenode Tagmentase, Diagenode #C01070010-20, EZ-Tn5 Transposase, Lucigen #TNP92110, or expressed/purified with an in house protocol). For example, if the concentration of unloaded Tn5 is 0.40 mg/mL, the monomer concentration in uM is 7.55 µM based on molar mass of monomer Tn5 ~53,000 g/mol [0.4 mg/mL * (1 mol/53,000 g)].  CRITICAL STEP: Anneal transposons and load Tn5 on the day of experiment 1-2 h prior experiment starts. Combine transposons and mix well before adding Tn5 to make sure that both transposons are sufficiently homogeneous prior to mixing with Tn5. Avoid generating bubbles when mixing Tn5 with transposons by pipetting slowly and do not fill pipette tip with air. If the experiment is not ready, store loaded Tn5 at -20 ºC.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63ns3","text":"Thaw non-annealed transposons (Nextera adapter 1/ME and 5P-Nextera adapter 2/ME) on ice. Briefly vortex and quick spin the tube. Anneal transposons on thermocycler using following program: 95 ºC 5 min, slowly cool down to 65 ºC (0.1 ºC/s), 65 ºC 5 min, slowly cool down to 4 ºC (0.1 ºC/s) and hold at 4 ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"av29u","text":"Load transposons 1.5x molar ratio to Tn5. The amount below is sufficient for tagmenting ~ 1.8 million nuclei/cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8i21h","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"21rm0","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9j0u6","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ap8r0","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"92upd","text":"Add annealed Nextera adapter 1/ME and annealed 5P-Nextera adapter 2/ME into the bottom of 1.5 mL DNA LoBind microtube, mix well by pipetting 10 times or gently vortexing and briefly spin the tube on mini centrifuge for 3 s. Addunloaded Tn5 and mix by gently pipetting 20 times (set the volume of p200 pipette to 80 µL). Quick spin the tube and incubate at 25 ºC for 0.5 h, 350 rpm. The final concentration of loaded Tn5 is 7.35 µM (monomer Tn5 concentration).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":382,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8buir","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1e9n4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"13","error":false,"guid":"4A728AF083A311EA85E74DBC58B208F9","id":"86849","label":"37.72 uM monomer Tagmentase (2mg/mL)","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"7.35","error":false,"guid":"5D2ADEE083A311EA85E74DBC58B208F9","id":"86850","label":"50 uM Annealed Nextera adapter 1/ME","unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"7.35","error":false,"guid":"6B35894083A311EA85E74DBC58B208F9","id":"86851","label":"50 uM Annealed 5P-Nextera adapter 2/ME","unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"39","error":false,"guid":"4B0FB66032F511EC9A0CA9EAFA02599D","id":0,"label":"Tagmentase Dilution Buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"9511A2A032F511EC9A0CA9EAFA02599D","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"egbag","text":"Isolate nuclei from tissue following tissue-specific nuclei extraction protocol (dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.ufketkw) with 0.1 U/µL of SUPERase In RNase Inhibitor and 0.2 U/µL of Enzymatics RNase Inhibitor. For cell lines, nuclei can be extracted with ATAC Lysis buffer with 0.1% NP-40 as previously described with the addition of RNase inhibitors, and increase lysis volume proportional to the number of input cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":81,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":81,"length":40}],"data":[]},{"key":"98qab","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"44EA3B0184C011EAAB080242AC110005","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.ufketkw"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9q4mk","text":"Prepare 1x PBS + RI (1 mL per sample) and keep on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cm3jd","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"c946","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"fb8op","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"441iq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1000","guid":"62739A8083A411EA85E74DBC58B208F9","id":"86852","label":"PBS, pH 7.4","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"2.5","guid":"6ECF5C6083A411EA85E74DBC58B208F9","id":"86853","label":"SUPERase In (20 U/uL)","unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1.25","guid":"7F67415083A411EA85E74DBC58B208F9","id":"86854","label":"Enzymatics Rnase In (40 U/uL)","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fijh7","text":"Prepare 1% (wt/vol) formaldehyde in 1x PBS (1 mL per sample) and keep on ice. CRITICAL: formaldehyde solution should be in 1x PBS and methanol free.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7k57e","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8ga4k","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"eckfq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"937.5","guid":"8E01818083A411EA85E74DBC58B208F9","id":"86855","label":"PBS, pH 7.4","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"62.5","guid":"9C302EA083A411EA85E74DBC58B208F9","id":"86856","label":"Formaldehyde, 16% wt/vol","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1k94s","text":"Resuspend 1-2 million nuclei with 1 mL 1x PBS + RI and keep on ice. To each tube of 1 mL volumes of nuclei suspensions, add 15 µL of hashing oligos. Make a note of which oligo was added to which sample. Mix briefly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5dvf4","text":"Add 1 mL of 1% formaldehyde to nuclei suspension and pipette gently 8 times. Briefly spin the tube on mini centrifuge at room temperature for 3 s and aliquot 75 µL of tagmentation reaction into 1.5 mL DNA LoBind tube. {"blocks":[{"key":"avgn4","text":"Remove the plate from thermocycler and put on ice or PCR cool rack then pool all reactions into a chilled 25 mL reservoir and transfer pooled reaction into a chilled 5 mL DNA LoBind tube. steps.section: sn/scATAC libraries: Quality validation by MiSeq sequencing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7g2d2","text":"Validate AC sequencing libraries with MiSeq sequencing using v2 reagent kit by loading at 20 pm based on Qubit dsDNA HS quantification with at least 5% PhiX spike in following Illumina  loading guide. The sequencing configuration is 75 cycles for read 1, 94 cycles for index 1, 8 cycles for index 2, and 75 cycles for read 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"68mdi","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"gqtt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9va2e","text":"CRITICAL STEP: For MiSeq sequencing, quantification of sequencing library concentration by Qubit and determination of average library size is sufficient. For high-throughput sequencing, we recommend to run sequencing libraries on Bioanalyzer, TapeStation or equivalent instrument that can determine accurate average library size and contamination of adapter dimers peaks at approximately 125-175 bp. We recommend to run qPCR to quantify sequencing library concentration using the average library size derived from TapeStation. For a two-channel sequencing system such as NovaSeq, we recommend to spike-in with minimum of 10% PhiX or consult sequencing core.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

The sequencing configuration is 70 cycles for read 1, 6 cycles for index, and 102 cycles for read 2.a","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5npu2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a7ikm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4bch2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8oeq","text":"CRITICAL STEP: For MiSeq sequencing, quantification of sequencing library concentration by Qubit and determination of average library size is sufficient. For high-throughput sequencing, we recommend to run sequencing libraries on Bioanalyzer, TapeStation or equivalent instrument that can determine accurate average library size and contamination of adapter dimers peaks at approximately 125-175 bp. We recommend running qPCR to quantify sequencing library concentration using the average library size derived from TapeStation. For a two-channel sequencing system such as NovaSeq, we recommend spike-in with a minimum of 10% PhiX or consult sequencing core.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"82vn0","text":"In PCR strip tubes, use 5 ng of R-A as template for enrichment of hashing libraries and adjust the volume of template to 10 µL with nuclease-free water and quick spin down the tubes. CRITICAL STEP: If the concentration of PCR product is higher than 5 ng/µL, it tends to have high error to pipette the volume smaller than 1 µL. We recommend to aliquot R-A, dilute into 0.5 ng/µL in total 30-50 µL and use 10 µL as template for 2nd PCR","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
